1.name: First Powered Flight
1.description: The Wright brothers achieve the first powered flight.

1.name: Ford Model T Introduced
1.description: The Ford Model T is introduced, revolutionizing the automobile industry.

1.name: First World Series
1.description: The first World Series in baseball takes place between the Boston Americans and the Pittsburgh Pirates.

1.name: Panama Canal Construction Begins
1.description: Construction of the Panama Canal officially begins.

1.name: Nobel Prize Established
1.description: The first Nobel Prizes are awarded, established by Alfred Nobel's will.

1.name: Start of World War I
1.description: WWI begins after the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand.

1.name: Sinking of the Titanic
1.description: The RMS Titanic sinks on its maiden voyage, resulting in over 1,500 deaths.

1.name: Women’s Suffrage Movement Gains Ground
1.description: The Representation of the People Act is passed in the UK, granting voting rights to women over 30.

1.name: The League of Nations Established
1.description: The League of Nations is established to promote peace after WWI.

1.name: Spanish Flu Pandemic
1.description: The Spanish flu pandemic begins, affecting millions worldwide.

1.name: Prohibition in the United States
1.description: The 18th Amendment begins Prohibition, banning the sale of alcohol.

1.name: The Great Gatsby Published
1.description: F. Scott Fitzgerald’s 'The Great Gatsby' is published, defining the Jazz Age.

1.name: First Transatlantic Flight
1.description: Charles Lindbergh makes the first solo nonstop transatlantic flight.

1.name: Stock Market Crash
1.description: The Wall Street Crash marks the beginning of the Great Depression.

1.name: Women Gain the Right to Vote in the U.S.
1.description: The 19th Amendment is ratified, granting women the right to vote.

1.name: The Great Depression Begins
1.description: The stock market crash leads to widespread economic hardship.

1.name: Hitler Becomes Chancellor of Germany
1.description: Adolf Hitler is appointed Chancellor, marking the rise of the Nazi regime.

1.name: Dust Bowl Begins
1.description: Severe drought and poor farming practices lead to massive dust storms in the U.S. Midwest.

1.name: World War II Begins
1.description: Germany invades Poland, triggering the start of WWII.

1.name: Social Security Act Passed
1.description: The Social Security Act is signed into law in the U.S.

1.name: Pearl Harbor Attack
1.description: Japan attacks Pearl Harbor, leading to the U.S. entering WWII.

1.name: D-Day Invasion
1.description: Allied forces launch a massive invasion of German-occupied France.

1.name: United Nations Established
1.description: The UN is founded to promote international cooperation and peace.

1.name: Atomic Bombs Dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki
1.description: The U.S. drops atomic bombs, leading to Japan's surrender.

1.name: The Marshall Plan Announced
1.description: The U.S. launches the Marshall Plan to aid European recovery post-WWII.

1.name: Korean War Begins
1.description: The Korean War begins as North Korea invades South Korea.

1.name: Brown v. Board of Education
1.description: The Supreme Court rules that racial segregation in public schools is unconstitutional.

1.name: Launch of Sputnik
1.description: The Soviet Union launches Sputnik, the first artificial satellite, marking the start of the space race.

1.name: Civil Rights Movement Gains Momentum
1.description: Rosa Parks is arrested for refusing to give up her bus seat, sparking the Montgomery Bus Boycott.

1.name: Formation of NATO
1.description: The North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) is formed as a military alliance.

1.name: Civil Rights Act Passed
1.description: The Civil Rights Act is signed into law, prohibiting discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.

1.name: Moon Landing
1.description: Apollo 11 lands the first humans on the Moon.

1.name: Assassination of John F. Kennedy
1.description: President Kennedy is assassinated in Dallas, Texas.

1.name: Vietnam War Escalates
1.description: U.S. combat troops are sent to Vietnam, marking a significant escalation of the conflict.

1.name: Woodstock Music Festival
1.description: The iconic Woodstock festival takes place, symbolizing the counterculture of the 1960s.

1.name: Watergate Scandal
1.description: The Watergate scandal begins with a break-in at the Democratic National Committee headquarters.

1.name: End of Vietnam War
1.description: The Vietnam War ends with the fall of Saigon.

1.name: U.S. Recognizes China
1.description: The U.S. officially recognizes the People's Republic of China.

1.name: First Earth Day Celebrated
1.description: The first Earth Day is celebrated, marking the beginning of the modern environmental movement.

1.name: Formation of OPEC
1.description: OPEC imposes an oil embargo, leading to global energy crises.

1.name: Reagan Elected President
1.description: Ronald Reagan is elected the 40th President of the United States.

1.name: Challenger Disaster
1.description: The Space Shuttle Challenger explodes shortly after launch, killing all seven crew members.

1.name: Fall of the Berlin Wall
1.description: The Berlin Wall falls, marking the symbolic end of the Cold War.

1.name: AIDS Epidemic Recognized
1.description: The first cases of what will be recognized as AIDS are reported.

1.name: Chernobyl Nuclear Disaster
1.description: A reactor at the Chernobyl nuclear power plant explodes, leading to one of the worst nuclear disasters in history.

1.name: Introduction of the World Wide Web
1.description: The World Wide Web is launched, revolutionizing communication and information sharing.

1.name: End of the Cold War
1.description: The Soviet Union officially dissolves, marking the end of the Cold War.

1.name: Dissolution of Yugoslavia
1.description: The breakup of Yugoslavia begins, leading to a series of conflicts in the region.

1.name: Rwandan Genocide
1.description: A genocide in Rwanda leads to the deaths of an estimated 800,000 people.

1.name: Oklahoma City Bombing
1.description: A domestic terrorist bombing of the Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building results in 168 deaths.

1.name: September 11 Attacks
1.description: Terrorist attacks in the U.S. result in significant loss of life and changes in global security policies.

1.name: Launch of the iPod
1.description: Apple launches the iPod, revolutionizing how music is consumed.

1.name: U.S. Invades Afghanistan
1.description: The U.S. launches military operations in Afghanistan following the September 11 attacks.

1.name: Completion of the Human Genome Project
1.description: The Human Genome Project is completed, mapping the entire human genome.

1.name: Financial Crisis
1.description: The global financial crisis begins, leading to widespread economic downturn.

2.name: The Berlin Wall Stands Firm
2.description: In an unexpected turn of events, the Berlin Wall does not fall. Instead, a series of political negotiations and military posturing leads to a strengthened division of East and West Berlin. The Soviet Union reasserts its control over Eastern Europe, resulting in a prolonged Cold War era, where tensions escalate, but actual conflict is avoided. This event marks not only the persistence of the Iron Curtain but also a new phase of ideological conflicts and proxy wars across the globe.
